div.p: Josef Saphir, proprietor of the piano manufacturing company Saphir, founded in 1886, located at Praterstraße 34 in the 2nd district of Vienna (Leopoldsstadt), and at Radetzkystraße 7 in the 3rd district (Landstraße). He was active also as a piano dealer between 1897 and 1909. His wife was Mathilde Saphir.
Saphir was in contact with Schenker in May 1918. No correspondence is known to survive between Josef Saphir and Schenker, but a letter from his wife is preserved as OJ 14/3 (1917).
Sources:Das Jahrbuch der Wiener Gesellschaft 1928, ed. Franz Planer (Vienna 1928), p. 291
Hellmut Federhofer, Heinrich Schenker nach Tagebüchern und Briefen... (Hildesheim: Georg Olms, 1985), p. 250
Jens-Uwe Witter, Das Klavier-Lexikon. Namen und Fabrikate aus dem Klavier-, Orgel- und Harmoniumbau sowie Handel und Service von 1788-2000, 2nd edn (Rothenburg ob der Tauber, 2000), pp. 634-635
